storyInfo: Horn's message to Londinium turns out fruitless. Jane obtains information from a good friend about a Taran meeting, and passes it onto Bagpipe. Bagpipe and Horn resolve to head for the meeting to find out what they can.

attributes.content: 4:23 P.M. \ Cloudy, turning overcast
MacMartin Brothers' Chip, first floor
Still no reply?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: None. Haven't gotten a peep from Londinium, yesterday or today.
attributes.name: Chef MacMartin

attributes.content: It's been twenty hours. They have to have received my last telecoms by now.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Could the encrypted line be faulty?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Hard to say, sir. Being honest, it's been nearly ten years since I graduated, transferred to Hillock. There's not much information you need to activate this secret comms line.
attributes.name: Chef MacMartin

attributes.content: Two years back, around the end, I reported to our group's boss, and he asked me if I had anything to say other than whatever number kid was being born. And that if I hadn't, I could save even giving the routine reports.
attributes.name: Chef MacMartin

attributes.content: Oh, no wonder you opened this chippy.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Not a bad plan, right? Codename's not Chef for fun. Thought at the time, suppose some outsider wanted to sniff out our liaison point, they'd only suspect next door's bookshop.
attributes.name: Chef MacMartin

attributes.content: Aye, right. Besides, your chips are delicious too!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Ought to be, eh? Hahah, you fill yourselves up.
attributes.name: Chef MacMartin

attributes.content: Hillock's potatoes are high quality. Locals all love my chipsâ€”if I didn't still remember my actual job as a lamplighter, I would've opened up branches ages ago. Five, six of them.
attributes.name: Chef MacMartin

attributes.content: Ah, anyhow, I thought I was dreaming of the time I was in training again, when you gave the secret knock at the door yesterday.
attributes.name: Chef MacMartin

attributes.content: ...It seems highly likely this line was abandoned long ago.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Or perhaps, someone's received our info, but doesn't want to reply.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: You mean there's people interceptin' our intel on purpose, Leader?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Not easy to say yet.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: We'll send the next report as we would originallyâ€”right, and besides Triangle's findings, add on the outcome of my dialogue with Colonel Hamilton.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: The Colonel's targeted measures against a portion of the residents are already extremely suspicious. In the worst case, I'd like for our team to be allowed more flexibility.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: That... sounds like there's no point in me convincing you to use a barracks Messenger, is there?
attributes.name: Chef MacMartin

attributes.content: Ugh. Leader, I don't wanna say this, but we're a little low on numbers.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: That definitely isn't like you to say. Relax, though. Nobody wants to take that step.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: But... the circumstances about this city are far more complicated than any of us foresaw.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Chef, seeing as you've been in County Hillock for so long, how do you feel about the people here?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Nothing unusual to me. If you put a Taran in front of me right now, I wouldn't fancy them much different from a Victorian anywhere else.
attributes.name: Chef MacMartin

attributes.content: To tell the honest truth, if life's not bad, who'd want to make trouble all the livelong day?
attributes.name: Chef MacMartin

attributes.content: Quite a few wear ideals on their sleeves, but only a minority ever take them to heart. Most just care about filling their stomachs, and if they're full, they can care about the purse, too.
attributes.name: Chef MacMartin

attributes.content: Right you are! I can barely imagine Damian Barry caught up in the spectre force either.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: In my eyes, him and the locals were all normal people, scared stiff beggin' for forgiveness the moment they're arrested, comin' together when a loved one dies just so they could fall to pieces and weep.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: They're nothin' like trained soldiers at all.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: What you're saying is exactly what I'm worrying aboutâ€”Colonel Hamilton might have been spouting more than just alarmist talk.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: When ordinary people take up weapons, voluntarily or not, the disaster we then face will be the likes of which Victoria hasn't seen for a very long time.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Afternoon, Saoirse! Lucky me, I was just about to go find you at the newspaper.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Eh? What's wrong, Saoirse? Were you just crying?
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Janie... No, I'm alright. I'm perfectly fine.
attributes.name: Saoirse

attributes.content: Pull the other one. Your eyes are all puffy, and your face is pale as sheets. The Saoirse I know would never be caught in the street looking this ghastly. Something gave you a nasty shock, didn't it?
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Who bullied you? Was it that soldier from last time? I'll help you think of something... There has to be something.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: No, Janie, don't you fuss. He hasn't come bothering me again.
attributes.name: Saoirse

attributes.content: It's... I don't know how to put it.
attributes.name: Saoirse

attributes.content: Come on, deep breathsâ€”it's me right here, your very good friend. You're safe now, I promise.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Janie... why? Why are you one of them?
attributes.name: Saoirse

attributes.content: What are you talking about, Saoirse? I don't understand.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: I don't want you to get hurt. You're the best friend I have... and you're a good person. I'm good too, right? My ma, da, cousin... aren't we all good people?
attributes.name: Saoirse

attributes.content: Your cousin... Barry? You mean Damian Barry? I'm so sorry. I wasn't fast enough.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: It's not your fault. And I don't think it's mine. I just want to live life peaceful. I don't want to see any more people I care about die.
attributes.name: Saoirse

attributes.content: Cry it out, Saoirse... I'm here with you. Seeing a loved one pass on and still having to manage your work, it's too much pressure on you. Here, lean on my shoulder? It'll be more comfortable.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: That's okay, thank you, Janie, I'm much better just seeing you. I understand what I have to do nowâ€”
attributes.name: Saoirse

attributes.content: This is for you.
attributes.name: Saoirse

attributes.content: Is... this an address?
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: I could give you a few names, too. But there's no need. I don't want to put you in even more danger.
attributes.name: Saoirse

attributes.content: This address should be enough. You can... hand it to someone you think's reliable. Your Sergeant Major, or maybe another officer, like Uncle Louis.
attributes.name: Saoirse

attributes.content: I know there's people around asking about Damian. They want to be clear what it is we're plotting.
attributes.name: Saoirse

attributes.content: Plottingâ€”Saoirse, even you...?!
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: I'm not sure. You can believe me or notâ€”I've only been responsible for passing on some info some ways. A few notes stuck between book pages, one or two hidden signals in the Hillock Evening News's classifieds.
attributes.name: Saoirse

attributes.content: I used to think this was for making everyone safer... I didn't twig what dreadful things they're scheming, not until the... dispatch I just heard by the chief editor...
attributes.name: Saoirse

attributes.content: Never mind that. I'm not trying to justify myself or even repent, what's important is that you stop them as soon as you can.
attributes.name: Saoirse

attributes.content: Alright, I will. I'm sure of who I should give this to. She'll fairly treat you all, more than anyone else would. Saoirse, don't be scared. Everything will be alright.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Alright, Janie. I trust you.
attributes.name: Saoirse

attributes.content: Remember, it's 8 P.M. Hold onto this address tightâ€”
attributes.name: Saoirse

attributes.content: East side of the statue at District Ten... third alleyway on the left. There's a bookshop there, with a flower pot by the door... yellow rose... found it.
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: To... Bag... pipeâ€”
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: (Do I just leave it under the flowerpot like this and call it done? A loose brick right there, exactly like they said this morning.)
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: (This really is an unusual way of receiving your letters.)
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: (Friend from Londinium, I hope you can be of help to Saoirse... and all of us.)
attributes.name: Janie

attributes.content: Boss, someone left a new slip downstairs, under the yellow rose.
attributes.name: MacMartin Brothers Worker

attributes.content: Bring it in.
attributes.name: Chef MacMartin

attributes.content: Eh, yellow rose? So it's for me? That was fast.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: The informer you mentioned before?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Aye. She's a soldier at the barracks too, but I can assure you, Leader, she's warmhearted. She's good.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: I... hope you've gotten an eye for people.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: No worries! My eyesight's always been brilliant.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: What's it say on the slip?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: '109 Dam St, tonight 8pm'â€”that's all.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Dam Street? It's the boundary between Districts Ten and Eleven. Rings bells for meâ€”it's Baron Bolton's estate.
attributes.name: Chef MacMartin

attributes.content: Looks like there's an important meeting tonight. Bagpipe, we should go.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: This is where you were...
attributes.name: Operator Shredder

attributes.content: That's right. Sipping hot tea, skimming the paper, doing things befitting a woman of my age.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Phew, strong wind kicking up.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Found what you were looking for?
attributes.name: Operator Shredder

attributes.content: (Taran) When you want to find tomorrow, you go meet with yesterday.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: You can speak Taran?!
attributes.name: Operator Shredder

attributes.content: Can't speak much at all. What you hear is what you get. Just showing off what I learned.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Hard to believe... Oliver was right, you're an incredible one.
attributes.name: Operator Shredder

attributes.content: Hahah. You get a nice rush the first time you impress somebody, but there's diminishing returns on the second and third round.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Nobody at our office even knows how to speak Taran.
attributes.name: Operator Shredder

attributes.content: Considering your backgrounds, that's reasonable.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Oliver grew up in a middle-class household in north Londinium, with family roots in Gaul. He lives upstairs from the office these days, taking some time off every year to go back and see his wife and children.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Fred's more or less an apprentice from County Peninsula. He's got bunch of brothers and one little sister, and the whole family gets along like a dream.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Will's a local. His clan moved decades ago from a fixed village nearby, and his Taran blood's probably from his paternal grandmother.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: You've looked at our data?
attributes.name: Operator Shredder

attributes.content: Do I look like the type who does homework? Not my style.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Then... how do you know?
attributes.name: Operator Shredder

attributes.content: Language.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Name, pronunciation, wording, tone, and even where you pauseâ€”language tells a keen ear more than you could ever guess.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: I heard about how Sankta extraordinary are, but I never figured...
attributes.name: Operator Shredder

attributes.content: Ahah. Really, it's just a hobby of mine.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Anyhow, language itself holds a special significance to some folks. Why else would the Tarans have cared so much about digging a sample of their own language out of a pile of old books?
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: You're not wrong. Half a decade ago, barely any Tarans regularly spoke it.
attributes.name: Operator Shredder

attributes.content: And you?
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: You've probably heard it in me... I'm not a Taran. My wife was. She only taught me a word or two while she was still alive.
attributes.name: Operator Shredder

attributes.content: Yet nowadays, you see that gradually dying language all over the newspaper.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Plus, I just overheard someone outside the window teaching kids how to call each other in Taran.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Until you mentioned it... I never noticed.
attributes.name: Operator Shredder

attributes.content: Language binds a people together tighter than most things. A language doesn't get diluted over time like bloodlines do, and it doesn't get weighed on the scales of cost-benefit analysis like everything else.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Looks like there's some out there who want to exploit those ties, bring back together the community that's been loosening away. But with that, the gatherings that already were, lose their stability.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Victoria won't just sit back and let this play out right under its nose. And yet, the harder you pull, the harder the backlash will snap.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: You all know why I came, don't you?
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Actually... I'm not that sure. I just feel like, you wouldn't need to bother an elite operator to go fetch data in person.
attributes.name: Operator Shredder

attributes.content: Numbers on paper don't mean a thing against seeing it with your own two eyes. Put it that way, I really am here fetching data.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Could you just tell me one more time, in the last six months, how many local businesses suspended collaboration with us?
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Seven.
attributes.name: Operator Shredder

attributes.content: That's three on top of last month's report. In modern Victoria, when any wind stirs the grass, it's the big merchants' wallets that feel it first.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: I need to head out, get a few more eyefuls of this placeâ€”make it before this city gets drowned under dirty rain.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Leader, you've had your eyebrows wrinkled ever since morning.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: We don't have much time to go.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: This spectre force move is inconsistent in ways with past incidents.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Their execution was covert before, rapid. Every time we thought to chase them, we'd find the leads wiped clean.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: But now...
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Oh, like they finished knittin' a jumper and just tossed yarn ends on the floor? Barely an idea of how each end is linked, too.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: And moreover... these leads have all cut off at County Hillock.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: It's not just you. I'm feelin' trapped as all heck too.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: This city is just like a pressure cooker sealed shut. The residents, the barracks, everyone's twitchy, and people are gettin' up in arms anywhere and anytime.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Everyone's waiting. Waiting for when the first bolt strikes.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: But if it does truly strike, what will this city... no, what will Victoria become?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: (Leader...!)
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: (Hm?)
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: (Someone's tailin' us!)
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: (So they are... See that alley to the west?)
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: (Understood.)
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Stop where you are!
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Urghhâ€”
attributes.name: Craig

attributes.content: Eh, hold on, what? It's a little bairn... and you look kind of familiar, too?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Uwgh, ow...
attributes.name: Craig

attributes.content: Ah, sorry! I'll let go now. I thought it'd be some baddie followin' us.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: ...Ball.
attributes.name: Craig

attributes.content: You dropped your ball, so you came here to pick it up?
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: I'll ask you to hurry home now, it's not too safe here. Your mam and dad'll worry for you if you go runnin' all over.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: False alarm, Leader.
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: Just one child? No, that doesn't seem quite right.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: It wasn't just one person following us, and the fact they could go several streets without us noticing means they definitely have experience tailing.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Did you see anyone out of the ordinary just now, when you hid up high?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Ah... if I have to say, there was a street not far away with a particularly bright ring I caught a glimpse of...
attributes.name: Bagpipe

attributes.content: ...Sankta.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Lemme get a... piece of cake, and this apple pie... and I'll have some of those cookies, too.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Tough call... Warfarin has been telling me to lay off the sweets...
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Hey there. Quick question, which of these cakes is the sweetest?
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Like you don't know? C'mon, you've been in County Hillock a while, haven't you? If I had to guess, probably over three years of serviceâ€”
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Who are you?!
attributes.name: Restless Youth

attributes.content: Calm down. I could tell, and the nice folks you're following sure could too.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Your cover's blown anyway. Why don't you try some of this apple pie I bought? It's good, I'm telling you.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: You weird, mad Sankta. Where did you come from? Why are you trying to get in my way?
attributes.name: Restless Youth

attributes.content: Me? I'm not, I'm just passing by.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Team 12, target lost, but judging by the direction they disappeared, it's likely they're heading for Dam Street.
attributes.name: Restless Youth

attributes.content: Alright... I understand, I'll bring them straight away...
attributes.name: Restless Youth

attributes.content: We'll check through one by one.
attributes.name: Restless Youth

attributes.content: I'm warning you, Sankta, if it's not yours to meddle, don't meddle.
attributes.name: Restless Youth

attributes.content: Warning me...?
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: If I had a nickel for every time I heard that... You know, I ain't exactly used to walking around unarmed.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: ...I've got no time to listen to you talk big. Soldiers, we're moving.
attributes.name: Restless Youth

attributes.content: You can breathe now, shopkeep. The soldiers are all gone.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: Mind bagging up the sweets for me? I got some folks back at the office who oughta try them.
attributes.name: Outcast

attributes.content: After all... it's about time I called all my little friends back from their field work.
attributes.name: Outcast
